abstract.t: This memo documents the Internet Group membership AuthenticationProtocol (IGAP), a protocol developed by NTT, Nortel Networks andPanasonic. IGAP provides IGMP's group membership control betweenhosts and their first-hop routers, with the addition of userauthentication and accounting. IGAP is designed to be used in acontrolled or managed IPv4 multicast environment, when authenticationand accounting are required. The user authentication information inIGAP can enable a provider to control the distribution of themulticast traffic as well as to collect real time user accountinginformation in an environment where the last-hop access networks arenot shared.
